info.headline: Red Flag Warning issued April 09 at 2:45AM EDT until April 09 at 8:00PM EDT by NWS Miami
info.description: ...RED FLAG WARNING IN EFFECT FROM NOON TODAY TO 8 PM EDT THIS EVENING FOR LOW HUMIDITY...ROBUST WINDS...AND HIGH ERC VALUES FOR FIRE WEATHER ZONES 068...071...072...073...074...075...163... 166...167...168...170...172...173...174...263...266 AND 267... The National Weather Service in Miami has issued a Red Flag Warning...which is in effect from noon today to 8 PM EDT this evening. The Fire Weather Watch is no longer in effect. * Affected area...fire weather zones 068...071...072...073... 074...075...163...166...167...168...170...172...173...174... 263...266...and 267. * Wind...15 to 20 mph with higher gusts. * Humidity...Minimum values of 25 to 35 percent. * ERC...27 to 36. * Impacts...any fires that develop will likely see extreme fire behavior. Outdoor burning is not recommended.
info.instruction: A Red Flag Warning means that critical fire weather conditions are either occurring now, or will shortly. A combination of strong winds, low relative humidity, and warm temperatures can contribute to extreme fire behavior.
